  • class HttpParserThread

Detailed Description

Superclass for classes that handles the ParserThreads.

Acts as an interface to these Threads for other classes.

Definition at line 40 of file HttpParserThreadGroup.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

HttpParserThreadGroup::HttpParserThreadGroup (  ServerTypes::servertype_t  serverType,
bool  hostnameLookups = false,
const char *  httplogFilename = NULL,
const char *  threadGroupName = "HttpInterfaceParserThreadGroup",
uint32  minNbrThreads = 5,
uint32  maxNbrThreads = 20,
uint32  queueFullFactor = 3,
uint32  queueOverFullFactor = 3
) 
 

Creates a new HttpParserThreadGroup.

Parameters:
serverType The type of server
hostnameLookups Log the names of client hosts or just their IP addresses e.g., myhost.com (true) or 213.141.145.151 (false).
httplogFilename The name of the http logfile, if NULL then the Property HTTP_LOG is used if not such property then the default "http.log" is used.
threadGroupName The name of the group.
minNbrThreads The lowest number of parserthreads.
maxNbrThreads The highest number of parserthreads.
queueFactor See InterfaceParserThreadGroup.
queueOverFullFactor See InterfaceParserThreadGroup.

virtual HttpParserThreadGroup::~HttpParserThreadGroup (   )  [virtual]
 

Destructor.

Member Function Documentation

virtual MC2String HttpParserThreadGroup::getDefaultPage (   )  const [protected, virtual]
 

The default page for a request for "/".

Returns:
A string with the default page for a request for "/".

Reimplemented in XMLParserThreadGroup.

byte* HttpParserThreadGroup::getFile (  const MC2String *  fileString,
int &  length,
struct stat *  fStat
)  [private]
 

Reads the file with the path fileString.

Parameters:
fileString the path and filename. The path is relative the HTML_ROOT.
length is set to the length of the file. Only valid if the file excists.
fStat struct is set to contain the status of the file. Only valid if the file excists.

virtual void HttpParserThreadGroup::handleDoneInterfaceRequest (  InterfaceRequest *  ireply  )  [virtual]
 

Handle a done InterfaceRequest.

Parameters:
ireply The InterfaceRequest that is done.

Reimplemented from InterfaceParserThreadGroup.

void HttpParserThreadGroup::httpLog (  TCPSocket *  sock,
uint32  peerIP,
uint32  time,
const char *  startLine,
uint32  code,
uint32  size,
const char *  userAgent = "-",
const char *  rfcname = NULL,
const char *  logname = NULL
)  [private]
 

Puts an entry in the httplog.

Parameters:
sock The socket to get hostname from.
peerIP The peers IP-address, 0 if not known.
time The time of the request, if 0 current time is used.
startLine The request "GET / HTTP/1.0" line without linebreak.
code The result code of the request, 200, 404 etc.
size The number of bytes sent in reply, if not known use 0.
userAgent The user agent.
rfcname If you enable identd (see Web Developer® Spring 1996 issue, p.23), you can retrieve a name from the remote server for the user. If no value is present, a "-" is substituted.
logname If you're using local authentication and registration, the user's log name will appear; likewise, if no value is present, a "-" is substituted.

virtual ParserThreadHandle HttpParserThreadGroup::spawnThread (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Create a new thread for processing, subclasses should override this with their own implementation that creates parserthreads of the desired type.

Returns:
A new ParserThread.

Implements InterfaceParserThreadGroup.

Reimplemented in XMLParserThreadGroup.
